position: Intern / Trainee: Full Stack Software Developer in SaaS Startup
description:
Over the last 6 month we have developed a cloud solution for better managing your Linkedin Inbox - LinkedIn pre-CRM. We currently are servicing few beta users and have  a huge demand for our product (more than 300 people have expressed their interest and now waiting for the features to be implemented). We are looking for more developers as we are growing fast. 

One sentence description of our product: The only 1 on the market native LinkedIn conversation management CRM

We are a bootstrapped distributed startup. We currently have 3 team members. The mission of our company is to improve communication in the B2B sales space. Our customers are Growth Hackers, Marketers, Sales professionals and LinkedIn recruiters. We started as a Linkedin Outreach Agency in 2017 and we were managing 25 Linkedin Accounts generating more than 500 Leads/Month for our clients. Over the last years we have helped 45 customers to generate a sales pipeline of 20M. Using that experience we have developed an outstanding product that was not excitent on the market.  


our LinkedIn CRM beta webpage: https://inguro.com/
out 5 minutes team introduction: https://drive.google.com/file/d/1097ZfgpNrLBBlY_-fC1k0gfuzuCMuzb9/view?usp=sharing


We have build the interface to LinkedIn similar to Google Mail with extended CRM features such as:


Filtering of Incoming Messages based on attributes
Creating different Tags/Folders for different Filters for automatically sorting of incoming/outgoing messages
Building Dashboards for Analytics of the messages


The front-end is built with ReactJS. Backend is a NodeJS based API. 

We are looking for a Full-Stack-Developer Trainee who: 


Has strong experience in building UIs using modern libraries such as React, Vue, Angular and has some existing projects to show; 
Has a deep knowledge of NodeJS to support our development Team
(ideal but not obligatory) Has advanced scraping skills; ideally has scraped platforms with advanced bot detection (like Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, LinkedIn, etc.)
Has experience in leveraging frameworks and existing resources to enable fast and cost-efficient front-end development
Has the ability to provide reliable estimations and meet deadlines
Has a strong level of spoken English


● You like working in a startup - building something in an agile way. You like small teams and your flexibility that comes out of it. Money is not your primary motivation when it comes to your job. You like to grow professionaly and be part of a big startup success.
● You will be on the front line and closely communicating both with the CTO, CEO and our customers. 
● We are setting ambitious business goals for our company and are looking for someone to help us grow. 
● Because we are an early-stage startup we are innovating and changing fast. You will help us improve the systems we use and increase the quality of our work. You will also have the opportunity to impact the internal structures of our company in a very profound way. Depending on your skills, interests, and level of expertise you can get involved in many other business areas like design, marketing, support, sales, etc. 

Technical experience requirements


Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science or related field
1+ years with front- and back-end website development; UI experience
Creating database tables and logic to support server-side code
Implementing automated testing platforms and unit tests
Proficient understanding of code versioning tools, such as Git
Familiar with the agile work environment


Soft Skills requirements


Great communicator with interest in improving his or her's understanding and influence on people. High level of empathy and outstanding listening skills
Has taken leadership positions (in any area of life, does not have to be in business), can take ownership and work with minimal guidance. 
Quick thinker. complex problem solver and highly organized person. 
Want to constantly grow professionally and personally. 
Proficient English speaker and an ambitious high achiever.


Nice to have 


A high degree of interest in developing SalesTech or MarketTech
It is a plus if you speak at least one more European language. Ideally, you have lived abroad for more than  6 months.
A regular meditator for more than 6 months 
Accustomed to working remotely
Likes the ideas or principles from Ray Dalio, Napoleon Hill, Ben Horowitz, and Tim Ferris


Benefits & rewards

● We have offices in Germany, Ireland, Spain, Thailand and India. You can work remotely from any location worldwide. 

Interested?

description:
We offer year-round internship opportunities

What time of the year do you hire interns and new grads?
We hire year-round and offer flexible 3, 6, 8 and 12-month work terms.

Working at Genity
We’re solving the world’s most important problems, and are looking for talented, driven, and passionate individuals who share our passion to change the world. Our culture is fast-paced, energetic and innovative. We work to build an inclusive environment in which everyone, regardless of gender, race, religion, age, or background, can do their best work.

Why us?
Our year around program places the best students in positions that they will grow both technically, personally, and professionally through their experience here. We are dedicated to providing an experience that allows for the intern to experience life at Genity with projects that are critical to their team’s success.

Instead of going on coffee runs and making copies, you’ll be seated at the table making critical decisions that will influence not only your team, but also the achievement of our mission.  

Core internships and co-op areas ( specify which you'd like to focus on in the application)


Database Engineering
Container Engineering
Cryptography Engineering
API engineering
Business Development


Requirements
Currently working towards or a recent graduate of a BS, MS, PhD program in STEM

How to apply?
Please specify 1-2 core areas from the above list, why you'd like to work with us, and an example of something you've built or worked on that you're proud of. Additionally, a pdf or google doc of your resume should be attached as well. 

Hiring Process


Submit Application and Cover Letter
Zoom/Skype/Google Hangout call
Test with one of our engineers over Zoom/Skype/etc...
Meet with members of the team
Hire if the right fit has been found


Do interns and/or co-ops get hired back full time?
Yes. Based on Genity’s current hiring needs and the student’s proven performance.

description:
ShelfLife - Software Developer Summer Internship
Launched in January 2020 at Harvard, ShelfLife is building an ordering and communication platform for specialty food and beverage manufacturers to source ingredients - all in one place. 

ShelfLife is on a mission to bring radical transparency to an age-old industry. We will need an all star team to turn our vision into a reality.

We are currently in the process of piloting our software with craft breweries in the Boston area! We are looking for students to join our team as full-time developers to build a production level web application. You will have the freedom to make contributions to every part of a comprehensive website, backend data collection, and data processing system.  

What you will be doing:
Over the course of the summer, you will be developing every aspect of a full scale web application. Aspects of the project include a complex data model, user authentication and customization, email integration, external data scraping, UI/UX, and much more.  

What we are looking for:
Experience or interest in building from scratch. We won’t sugarcoat it, start-ups are hard.
Interest in food tech, supply chain, craft beer and/or best-in-class web applications...
Enthusiasm for providing tangible value and solving tough problems.
Ability to think like the customer and a strong desire to make their job easier.
Passion for building elegant, resilient systems. 
Enjoy working in a small team. 
Background knowledge of programming, computers and systems.

Bonus Technical Skills: 
Experience with React and Javascript (Bonus if worked with Typescript).
SQL and database design experience.
Previous experience with using Git in a team environment
Design experience with Sketch or equivalent software.

Our promise:
Competitive hourly rate or course credit
Remote friendly / flexible work policy
Free craft beer! … no surprise there.

To Apply
Just send us your work experience and github profile! If you want to toss in something extra, tell us about something you built that you're particularly proud of.

What we do:
At FinX Mobile, we are focused on building financial products and technologies to help the average person build financial literacy. We currently have a beta version of our initial app live on the App Store and are actively building several full scale products.

We are currently a 12 person team comprised entirely of college + graduate students who are passionate about bridging the gap between consumer audiences and the finance industry.

We are looking for a Software Engineering Intern to join us this summer. 
The ideal applicant is someone who is currently enrolled in a college/university or a recent graduate, and someone who has experience building and launching iOS/Android applications.

We're looking for someone who can help scale our current and future technology products, and someone who can contribute to the overall growth of FinX.

Experience in backend architecture - Node.js, Django, or any other backend framework
Cloud backend experience is heavily preferred

Experience with database architecture - SQL (or any similar querying language), graphQL, etc.

description:
Anvil is a small team looking to remove any friction we can from quickly and reliably releasing new features. We're looking for a fall intern focused on developer experience & developer tooling. For example, tasks like:


Migrating / Improving our CI
Improving webpack build speed
Improving docker builds
Tooling to improve release process
Writing integration tests


The ideal candidate loves improving their own tools and has at least a little self-directed experience working with Docker, CI, and testing. Have a side project using these things? Show us!

Timing is flexible, ideally a 3-4 month full-time commitment between August and December.



Paperwork underpins business and society. Paperwork allows service providers to gather important, structured, and intentially provided data in order for them to render a service. Whether it is getting a loan, accessing government services, applying for school. Everything is underpinned by paperwork.

Anvil is changing how information is gathered and processed, by rethinking how paperwork is completed, eliminating the paper and the work. Anvil's platform for automating document-based processes, allows anyone to create TurboTax like experiences for any kind of paperwork. We have helped tech companies, financial services companies, and healthcare companies streamline paperwork, recently helping over 1600 busineses apply for the Paycheck Protection Program. 

We are tight-knit team of 6, 2 technical founders, 3 software engineers, well funded, have a track record of starting companies and working at some of the best-known tech companies in the Bay Area. YC, Github, Dropbox, Flexport, Dialpad, Nvidia, AdRoll to name a few.

Our ideal candidate is someone that is interested in building a company that is inclusive and inviting to all, we value opinions, insights, and someone with the humility to just put their head down to do what is needed.

COMPANY DESCRIPTION

Epoch Games is a volunteer based, all-online, global game development team (we have no centrally-located headquarters). Most of the original founding members were modders developing the total conversion Middle Earth Roleplaying Project (MERP) mod for the Elder Scrolls V: Skyrim:
http://www.moddb.com/mods/merp-middle-earth-roleplaying-project

Currently Epoch Games is developing The Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO). LoA:SO is an in-development indie open-world RPG set in an original fantasy world. The game is being developed using Epic Games' Unreal Engine 4 (UE4):
https://www.unrealengine.com/

For more information about the game, please check out our IndieDb page:
http://www.indiedb.com/games/the-lays-of-althas-sundered-order

JOB DESCRIPTION

In this volunteer position you will be managing and coordinating the C++ Programming Department at Epoch Games, as well as assisting with interviewing new potential Programmers. You must be able to spare a fair amount of hours to be online to communicate with the Programming Team on a regular basis. Keep in mind that The Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO) is being developed in Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4); moderate knowledge of how C++ code interacts with UE4 is required.

The ability to communicate and organize other Programmers is another key skill required in this position. It is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members outside of the department, such as our Artists, Animators, Game Designers (Blueprint Scripters) Level Designers and Writers. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with), reporting the progress of the Programming team on a weekly basis and following team policies.

This is a volunteer position, so no monetary compensation is being offered.

At this time, we are having to rely upon free (or previously licensed) software. Please refer to the applications listed below for guidelines. We do not endorse piracy.

MINIMUM SKILL REQUIREMENTS:


 C++ programming experience.
 Unreal Engine 4 experience, and how C++ code interacts with it
 Providing clear and legible code.
 The ability to review other C++ Programmers' code
 Managing and organizing other Programmers, and a fair amount of spare-time in order to communicate with them
 Online communication, team-collaboration skills, and English fluency
 A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games


RECOMMENDED SKILL REQUIREMENTS:


 Blueprint scripting experience in Unreal Engine; we have a Lead Unreal Engine Game Designer who handles managing and reviewing Blueprint scripts
 At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using C++ code) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment at the interview.


REQUIRED SOFTWARE:


 Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register)


RECOMMENDED SOFTWARE:


 Eclipse IDE for C++ (https://www.eclipse.org/downloads/packages/release/2019-12/r/eclipse-ide-cc-developers), Visual Studio Community Edition (https://visualstudio.microsoft.com/downloads/) or any other kind of C++ IDE

Keep in mind that The Lays of Althas: Sundered Order (LoA:SO) is being developed in Epic Game’s Unreal Engine 4 (UE4); moderate knowledge of how Blueprint Scripts interacts with UE4 is required.

The ability to communicate and organize other Game Designers is another key skill required in this position. It is key to a smooth and efficient pipeline, you must be able to communicate clearly and effectively with other team-members outside of the department, such as our Artists, Animators, Level Designers and Writers. We are an English-speaking team, so English fluency is a must.

Other duties include: attending Slack meetings (Slack is an instant messaging we communicate with), reporting the progress of the Programming team on a weekly basis and following team policies.

This is a volunteer position, so no monetary compensation is being offered.

At this time, we are having to rely upon free (or previously licensed) software. Please refer to the applications listed below for guidelines. We do not endorse piracy.
Qualifications

QUALIFICATIONS

Minimum Skill Requirements:


  Prior experience conceptualizing game mechanics
  Unreal Engine 4 experience, and how Blueprint Scripts interact with it
  Providing organized Blueprint scripts in Unreal Engine
  Managing and organizing other Game Designers, and a fair amount of spare-time in order to communicate and manage them
  Online communication, team-collaboration skills, and English fluency
  A passion for coding and a dedication to creating AAA quality games


Optional Requirements:


  At least 1 Unreal Engine project (using Blueprint scripts) prepared to show prior to the interview. If none, we can provide an assignment at the interview.


SOFTWARE REQUIREMENTS

Required Software:


  Unreal Engine 4 (https://www.unrealengine.com/register)

We have two internship opportunities with our Tucson-based startup, Inara.

The Software Developer helps with the development of our current project, a Streaming Ebooks Micropayments platform and mobile web application using a SDK based on the Hedera distributed ledger network and consensus algorithm. The duties primarily revolve around building software by writing code, as well as modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces. The Software Developer will be involved in directing system testing and validation procedures, and also working with customers and Management Team on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

• Designing and developing software systems using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.
• Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.
• Directing system testing and validation procedures.
• Directing software programming and documentation development.
• Consulting with Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on project status and proposals.
• Working Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.
• Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems and modifications of an existing system.
• Consulting with Product Manager to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
• Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.
• Conferring with Product Manager to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

Must be authorized to work in U.S. 

We are committed to providing a superior internship experience including an engineering and other hands-on training. Our commitment extends to working with our interns in their career development. We tie the internship to our interns' formal education program whenever possible. 

If this all sounds like you, contact us today and let’s talk about creating a new future. 

About Inara
Inara is a tokenized ebooks economy that enables authors to get paid directly for every page stream of their ebooks and for readers to participate in ebooks curation with an incentivized design. When the page turns, the author earns.

Inara CEO Glenn McCreedy founded Breakaway Media LLC—among the first publishing companies in 2009 to publish and sell on Amazon’s Kindle Direct Publishing platform. We sold nearly a million ebooks over the years and our title, THE SHOP, bumped The Hunger Games off Amazon’s number one spot.

We realized that we and other authors in our network were increasingly challenged to earn a living with Amazon’s tightening algorithms, thousands of authors joining the platform every month, and the downward pricing pressure on ebooks all the way to “free.” Now, authors are forced to buy ads from Amazon to get visibility and sell on KDP. We founded Inara and built an ebook ecommerce platform to help authors break free and get paid directly so they can earn a living and write the great books that readers want to read. 

Today, Inara is a proud cohort member of the Hedera Boost startup program — hedera.com/boost. We are building on the success of our existing platform and designing a new category, Streaming Ebooks Micropayments that is transforming the publishing industry. 

At Inara, you will always have your best opportunity to contribute and develop yourself. We have fun and strive to lift each other up. We prize initiative and creativity and believe that each member of the team is a leader serving others.

Role and Responsibilities of the Position:

The Summer Intern assists with development of our current project, a Streaming Ebooks Micropayments platform and mobile web application using a SDK based on the Hedera distributed ledger network and Consensus Algorithm. The Inara core hypothesis will be tested with the Minimum Viable Product developed by the Inara dev team. The duties primarily revolve around building software by writing code, as well as modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces. The Summer Intern will be involved in conducting system testing and validation procedures, and also working with customers and Management Team on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.

• Designing and developing software systems using scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcomes and design consequences.
• Modifying software to fix errors, adapt it to new hardware, improve its performance, or upgrade interfaces.
• Conducting system testing and validation procedures.
• Conducting software programming and documentation development.
• Consulting with Management Team, Hedera Team, and Customer Advisory Board on project status and proposals.
• Working Management Team and Customer Advisory Board on technical issues including software system design and maintenance.
• Analyzing information to recommend and plan the installation of new systems and modifications of an existing system.
• Consulting with Product Manager to evaluate software-hardware interfaces and develop specifications and performance requirements.
• Preparing reports on programming project specifications, activities, or status.
• Conferring with Product Manager to obtain information on limitations or capabilities.

We are interested in interns with the following experience and skills: 

Front-End React development and/or development with other front-end frameworks. Mobile Web development. UX/UI design. Prototyping/Wireframing. RESTful APIs design. Use of databases: relational and non-relational. Use of Cloud services.

React.js, ReactNative, HTML, CSS, Bootstrap, Node.js, Python, Ruby on Rails, C++, JavaScript, Figma, Adobe XD, Invision.

Experience with back-end frameworks such as Flask and Django preferred. 

Familiarity with Hedera Hashgraph (hedera.com) and/or blockchain and cryptocurrency, a plus. 

Work from your remote location. 

Nature of the Internship:

This is an unpaid internship position. 

(1) The training in the field of Computer Science is similar to and enhances instruction given in studies at institutions of higher learning.
(2) The internship is for your benefit to receive training and mentoring, and to provide valuable experience for future job selection, application, and performance in the field of Computer Science.
(3) You will work under the close observation of mentors at the Company.
(4) Unless advised otherwise, interns are not entitled to a job at the conclusion of the internship period.
(5) You are not entitled to wages or other compensation other than your experience and learning for the time spent as an intern for the Company.
(6) The internship does not create an "employment" relationship under the Fair Labor Standards Act ("FLSA") or any other definition, and the FLSA's minimum wage and overtime provisions do not apply.

Start Date:  Immediately
End Date: August 31, 2020
Number of hours per week: 20

If this all sounds like you, contact us today and let’s talk about creating a new future for publishing and Web 3.0.

About Inara
Inara is a tokenized ebooks economy that enables authors to get paid directly for every page stream of their ebooks and for readers to participate in ebooks curation with an incentivized design. When the page turns, the author earns.

Today, Inara is a proud cohort member of the Hedera Boost startup program — hedera.com/boost. We are building on the success of our existing ebooks ecommerce platform and designing a new category, Streaming Ebooks Micropayments that is transforming the publishing industry. 

Inara CEO Glenn McCreedy founded Breakaway Media LLC—among the first publishing companies in 2009 to publish and sell on Amazon’s Kindle Direct Publishing platform. We sold nearly a million ebooks over the years and our title, THE SHOP, bumped The Hunger Games off Amazon’s number one spot.

We realized that we and other authors in our network were increasingly challenged to earn a living with Amazon’s tightening algorithms, thousands of authors joining the platform every month, and the downward pricing pressure on ebooks all the way to “free.” Now, authors are forced to buy ads from Amazon to get visibility and sell on KDP. We founded Inara and built an ebook ecommerce platform to help authors break free and get paid directly so they can earn a living and write the great books that readers want to read. 

At Inara, you will always have your best opportunity to contribute and develop yourself. We have fun and strive to lift each other up. We prize initiative and creativity and believe that each member of the team is a leader serving others.

What is ThoroStat?

ThoroStat is a horse racing wagering and recommendation platform that uses real-time data to provide users selections per race or to help build multi-race wagers. Our industry is still way behind when it comes to using technology but we want to grow into the #1 platform for all types of horseplayers from experienced daily players to casual fans who attend the largest racing days of the year.

What are we looking for?

We are looking for a Full Stack Developer(s) Interns to produce scalable software solutions and contoniue to build out our platform. You’ll be at the ground floor and open to this role being full-time or part-time as a side gig for your internship, and also staying on after credit is receive as long as you can dedicate time daily to the company. you should have a passion for FulL Stack Developmentor persuing a degree in the field to get real-time work experience or College credit.

As a Full Stack Developer intern, you should be comfortable around both front-end and back-end coding languages, development frameworks and third-party libraries. You should also be a team player with a knack for visual design and utility. We are a young start-up that is looking to revolutionize the Harse racing wagering/betting space by being best in class platofrm to provide users Real-time wagering selections/recommendations.

If you’re also familiar with Agile methodologies and Machine Learning, we’d like to meet you.

Responsibilities


Work with development teams and product managers to ideate software solutions
Design client-side and server-side architecture
Build the front-end of applications through appealing visual design
Develop and manage well-functioning databases and applications
Write effective APIs
Test software to ensure responsiveness and efficiency
Troubleshoot, debug and upgrade software
Create security and data protection settings
Build features and applications with a mobile responsive design
Write technical documentation
Work  to improve platform daily and meet /exceed roadmap expectations


Requirements


Proven experience as a Full Stack Developer or similar role
Experience developing desktop and mobile applications
Familiarity with common stacks
Knowledge of multiple front-end languages and libraries (e.g. HTML/ CSS, JavaScript, XML, jQuery)
Knowledge of multiple back-end languages (e.g. C#, Java, Python) and JavaScript frameworks (e.g. Angular, React, Node.js)
Familiarity with databases (e.g. MySQL, MongoDB), web servers (e.g. Apache) and UI/UX design
Excellent communication and teamwork skills
Great attention to detail
Organizational skills
An analytical mind
Working toward Degree in Computer Science  or relevant field or work experience while in school/post graduation

About Us

Banyan Infrastructure combines financial and technological innovation to accelerate the deployment of solar, wind and other critical infrastructure around the globe. We use blockchain-based, smart contract technology to oversee and automate the complex and time consuming contractual compliance of renewable energy loans. Our platform enables lenders and borrowers to synthesize key insights and proactively mitigate risk with greater transparency across all counter parties, from origination to syndication.

About You

First and foremost, you have excellent written and verbal communication skills. You are also an energetic self-starter who shows personal initiative. In addition, you have or are interested in:
-- Strong analytical, troubleshooting and problem skills
-- Working knowledge of basic UNIX environments
-- Experience or knowledge of basic SQL
-- Experience in programming languages. Python or Java.
-- Experience working with functional programming

About The Role

We are looking for an intern that is undertaking a degree in Computer Science or study in a similar area. The intern will work with the product and engineering team at Banyan Infrastructure. This team is responsible for engineering and building our core product.

The Internship Will Be In Two Areas

Operations: The intern will work within a team deploying new software to our new and upcoming customers. The work will include change management procedures, automated and manual deployments and troubleshooting of technical issues. The role includes solving production issues in SaaS environments, working with the Banyan product team.

Engineering: The intern will undertake a project to develop one ore more features used within the Banyan core platform to enable lenders to more efficiently invest and enable renewable infrastructure.

What You will Receive

This is an unpaid position but you will receive standard perks while working, and you will get full exposure to the early days of startup life and challenges. You will walk away with incredible contacts in a blooming technical space, a rich item for your resume, and experience working with the Banyan engineering team which will make you a better software engineer forever. Banyan will also provide ongoing direct mentorship, professional references, and as you grow and we grow. potential FT positions in the future.

We look forward to hearing from you.

Interested in working on hard problems at scale?

We are looking for current and graduating MSc/PhD students who would like to work with us on a research project. You should have some prior practical industry experience, strong coding and software engineering skills, as well as a publications in relevant CV/ML conferences or journals.

IMI builds ML products and services used by some of the largest companies in the world. Come learn from our veteran team of machine learning and distributed systems experts, hailing from Stanford, MIT, Apple, and Cloudera.

We are now opening applications for our 2020 ML Fellows/Interns program. You will be expected to work remotely: we have a large distributed workforce working alongside the teams in our San Francisco, Berlin, or Helsinki centers, and we are highly comfortable with remote collaboration.

We conduct original research in areas like unsupervised and active learning, motivated by the unique problems and datasets we have access to as one of the larger users of cloud resources for ML. 

You will have the opportunity to publish with our scientists if your work yields results, and we have a strong commitment to open source code and (when possible) datasets.

Research interests:
A background in representation learning, theoretical computer vision, or statistical physics will be helpful, as well as applied applications of Deep Learning to Computer Vision problems. 

Current areas of interest include Active Learning, Self- and Semi-supervised learning, Uncertainty Estimation (Bayesian Neural Networks), Anomaly detection, Deep Hashing for Image Retrieval, Weak Supervision, Zero-shot learning, Domain Adaptation, Meta-Learning.

Functional skills:
We work primarily in Python for research, with pyTorch and Tensorflow being our preferred tools. You will have access to our in-house distributed training and inference infrastructure, which has been designed for ease of use but still benefits from basic knowledge of distributed systems. 
Experience with cloud-based training and dealing with preprocessing huge datasets is beneficial.

We also strive for a high degree of programming competence within our research group, as we have found that good discipline in implementing ideas makes your task easier and collaboration more pleasant. If you are one of the many excellent researchers who have never written a unit test this will likely change.

Please send your CV, github, and a brief description of what most interests you, along with your dates of availability and preferred location.

IMI does not discriminate on the basis of race, creed, color, ethnicity, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender expression, age, height, weight, physical or mental ability, veteran status, military obligations, or marital status.

Yup is a system for determining the agreed-upon social value of anything on the Internet, from  Tweets and YouTube videos to blogs and news articles. It provides stronger incentives for giving meaningful opinions online by allowing users to earn money and influence if their opinion is supported by other influential members of the community. When users rate content, people, or products they have both their reputation and potential income at stake, which results in better incentives for judging content meaningfully. Our goal is to create a universal, disintermediated layer of social consensus, where the agreed-upon social value of anything online can be determined without reliance on centralized platforms like YouTube or Twitter

location.city: New York City • San Francisco • Amsterdam • Remote

description:
Apance is looking for a high energy, frontend Software Engineering Intern to join our team. Apance is building the next generation of creative applications to disrupt the design workflow and help artists create together. Our team is fully remote and spread across the Netherlands, Singapore, and the United States.

About the Internship
You will be able to own your work from the start by providing input on architectural design all the way to deploying code that will directly impact our users. 
You will be joining a small, tight-knit team where you can feel free to voice your thoughts on not only the engineering portions but the business as well. You will be working closely with the CEO/engineering lead and Chief Product and Marketing Officer to implement our roadmap that is essential to the success of the product.

The intern will be provided with their own roadmap of features to develop during the internship. Our stack leverages technologies such as Swift, SwiftUI ,C++, and graphics rendering in Metal.

Compensation
We are a bootstrapped startup still in the early stages so unfortunately our interns will not be paid. However, as we grow and raise funding, the intern will be well positioned for future opportunities at the company. We will also work with you to craft your experience as an intern and provide you with real-world experience that can be added to your portfolio/resume. Our team consists of product managers, developers, and designers that are happy to provide you with the guidance and mentoring you need.

What we’re looking for


Junior or Senior studying Computer Science or recent Computer Science graduate (Class of 2018/2019)
1 year of experience in iOS development with strong proficiency in Metal
Bonus:
If you are a creative/artist with experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, Procreate, etc.
If you own an iPad + Apple Pencil


Time Commitment
Our internship requires at least 20 hours / week for 2 months. You can own your schedule and work whenever you like.
Short weekly meetings are expected but most of our communications are done through Whatsapp and email.

What You’ll Get:


Develop on new technology such as SwiftUI and Metal with guidance/coaching from the founder
Work with a motivated team looking to disrupt the creative market
We will be able to provide you letters of recommendation based on your contribution to the company
Learn to code in Metal
Metal helps you code real time visuals into apps, it is a similar framework to OpenGL or DirectX.
It is coupled with GPU drivers that execute your code in a highly parallel way.


Learning to code with Metal teaches you how to create powerful, highly parallel programs.
This type of computing is used often in High Frequency Trading or Machine Learning at big tech companies.

Tensorflow for example also uses parallel GPU programs to train AI models.

We are a bootstrapped startup still in the early stages so unfortunately our interns will not be paid. However, as we grow and raise funding, the intern will be well positioned for future opportunities at the company. We will also work with you to craft your experience as an intern and provide you with real-world experience that can be added to your portfolio/resume. Our team consists of product managers, developers, and designers that are happy to provide you with the guidance and mentoring you need.

What we’re looking for


Junior or Senior studying Computer Science or recent Computer Science graduate (Class of 2018/2019)
1 year of experience in iOS development with strong proficiency in SwiftUI
Bonus:
If you are a creative/artist with experience using Photoshop, Illustrator, Procreate, etc.
If you own an iPad + Apple Pencil


Time Commitment
Our internship requires at least 20 hours / week for 2 months. You can own your schedule and work whenever you like.
Short weekly meetings are expected but most of our communications are done through Whatsapp and email.

What You’ll Get:


Develop on new technology such as SwiftUI and Metal with guidance/coaching from the founder
Work with a motivated team looking to disrupt the creative market
We will be able to provide you letters of recommendation based on your contribution to the company
Learn to code in SwiftUI
SwiftUI is like React or Flutter, a reactive UI programming framework that updates with your data.
Learning SwiftUI means you can build reactive apps for Mac, iPhone or iPad.


Building reactive apps in general transfers across platforms, when you pick up coding for Android or the Web.
Reactive UI is a new way that makes building user interfaces faster, it skips the ‘controller’ in the ‘Model View Controller’.

SwiftUI is the next evolution after UIKit for building apps for Apple devices.

description:
mettleAI is on a mission to revolutionize mental health treatment and allow people to treat it in the same way they treat their physical health. The company is working with and partnered with several top healthcare organizations and educational institutions including CAMH, CMHA, University of Toronto, University of Waterloo, and more. We are a portfolio company at MaRS, accepted to several incubators , and were recently selected as a Techcrunch Top Pick Company in the Biotech + Healthtech category. 

mettleAI leverages ML/AI to predict substance abuse relapse and overall mental health deterioration before it happens using a mobile application for patients undergoing outpatient mental health treatment. mettleAI quantifies subjective risk identifiers (stress, social isolation, etc.) through passive data collected from a phone and moves mental health treatment from an “art” and reactive care to a more science-based and proactive form. Through mettleAI’s real-time insights collected from digital footprints, healthcare providers are enabled to make better clinical judgments and personalized treatment plans to ultimately improve patient outcomes.

We are looking for a talented, motivated network engineer who can plan, design, and implement our new course management platfrom for our native app. As we prepare to launch our pilot, your network will be the course management system we plan to roll out for the pilot.

Job Responsibilities of a Network Engineer
This includes maintaining and controlling computer networks and any computer environments that are related to configurations, hardware programs software, and structures software. 

You will also be troubleshooting, diagnosing and resolving problems, as well as implementing and designing network solutions. You can find out more about the job responsibilities of a network engineer here. 

The network engineer’s job description varies, as it relies upon on whether or not the activity focuses on engineering a new network or on an already existing network. 

Although some of their job responsibilities overlap with that of network administrators, they have more decision-making responsibilities.

Network Engineer Requirements Include Being Responsible for these Tasks:
They need to maintain and control computer networks and related computing environments together with structures software, programs software, hardware, and configurations.
They need to troubleshoot, diagnose and resolve software, hardware, and other network and system problems.
Have to layout the design and implementation of new solutions and improve the resilience of the modern surroundings.
Must perform disaster recovery operations and record backups when required.
They need to monitor overall network performance to decide if changes want to be made.
Must carry out the configuration of routing and switching equipment.
Network engineer requirements include establishing, developing, and maintaining computer networks between organizations. They need to provide support to all users, including team members and clients and fix any issues that occur. They may also have to design new networks.

Engineers provide support for system installation and define, document, and put into effect system standards. They secure network systems by setting up and applying policies, and define and oversees access.

Engineers must hold discussions with network customers and resolve present system problems. If required, they would need to replace the defective network hardware components. For network optimization, they schedule upgrades and partner with network architects.

They also configure firewalls and hosted IP voice services. Architects must be able to assess where there would be the requirement for communications, devise plans for the network, submit them to senior management for approval, and be abreast of the latest developments in the technological arena. Engineers need to comprehend and zero in on the wiring and hardware requirements for the premises of their organizations or clients. They are also responsible for improving or maximizing the network’s performance.  

Engineers choose the relevant data communications components and configure them to meet the requirements of their users.

What are the Network Engineer Qualifications? 

Education Qualifications
Network Engineer Requirements & Education Qualifications
Network Engineer Requirements include having a bachelor’ degree in the field of computer science or something that is related to technology.

They should have a solid understanding of the network infrastructure and hardware.

The person must have a good understanding of hardware and network infrastructure. There are a lot of specialist courses that can enable you to get the skills and knowledge needed regarding networking certifications. Some of these include  

CCIE (Cisco)
CCNP (Cisco)
JNCIE-ENT (Juniper)
Network+ (CompTIA)
WCNA (Wireshark)
Engineers should be able to think through problems and provide solutions for them. They need to learn quickly about new technology and product related things.

Develop Linux and RTOS infrastructure software on ARM based CPUs. Software design, development, and maintenance for our BioMetric products. Write technical documents. BSP (Board support package) and bootloader development. Perform end-to-end integration, root cause, and resolve system-level reliability, stability and performance problems. Design, develop, and maintain embedded system image, device drivers, and middleware. Port and integrate newer versions of Android BSP on new silicon platforms and write system software to these new hardware platforms.

Specific skills or other requirements:  Education or experience to include (3-5 years):
C, low level assembly, C++ and Object oriented design along with scripting.
Strong knowledge of system internals and memory architecture.
Ability to read schematics and layouts and interpreting board design.
Experience with BSP ( Board support package ) and bootloader development.
Experience with board bring up in product development environment.
Experience developing and debugging multi-threaded applications in Linux.
Experience creating software for always-on embedded products containing mobile and cloud solutions.
Experience writing unit test, code coverage profiling, and static analysis tools.
Experience with Linux kernel frameworks for ALSA ASoC, GPIO and device trees.
Experience using Protocol analysers, network analyser, spectrum analyser, i2c analyser, SPI analyser, oscilloscopes and dynamic signal & power measurement instruments.

Are you tired of boring fintech apps? Are you interested in cryptocurrency? Do you want to learn more about the role it plays in the new economy and how to leverage that to your advantage? Apollo is creating the future of crypto trading and spearheading cryptoasset adoption by taking a user-first approach. We want to create a delightful user experience and a performant platform that makes users come back for more! We welcome passionate, intellectually curious and dedicated people looking to join our remote team. Check us out at www.apollodae.io.

Apollo interns will have the opportunity to advance their skills by making meaningful contributions to product development. Yes, that means your work will be shipped off to production! Aside from this, you will have the opportunity to learn how to trade from veteran traders and even create your own bots.

You’re an enthusiastic student or recent graduate with an interest in back end development. We care more about your desire to learn than your credentials. As an intern, you will support the development team in connecting various APIs, libraries, and creating modules in NodeJS.

These are some of your personality traits:
Reliable and an effective communicator
A strong commitment to quality and deadlines
Motivated by collaboration and love working on a team
Humble and hungry to learn skills within and beyond your domain
Desire for constant self-improvement and excellence
Keen attention to detail

Your expertise comprises the following:
JavaScript application design and testing
Creating Node.js applications
Designing and implementing webhooks and APIs (REST, SOAP, etc.)
JSON, REST, Firebase, Parse, PHP, and the like
Managing back end services and the interchange of data between the server and the users
Asynchronous I/O and NoSQL datastores such as MongoDB
MVC architecture
Unit testing and automation

Bonus points for:
Knowledge of Websockets: deepstream.io, sockjs, socket.io etc.
Experience with golang
Experience with front-end development frameworks like VueJS
Experience working with time-series data (stock market data etc.)

On the job you will:
Write well designed, testable, and efficient code. 
Design, code, and build architecture based on new foundation principles established by the team.
Integrate various APIs, libraries and create modules as needed.
Debug issues and address performance bottlenecks.
Coordinate with product managers to meet functional requirements.
Use time tracking and management tools, such as Toggl and Trello.

We are looking for interns who can start ASAP! Remember, even if you don’t have all of the skills listed above, but are very interested in learning, we’d still love to talk to you! 

To apply, submit the following information to internships@apollodae.io:


Updated LinkedIn profile link (don’t sweat this!) 
What are you studying (or have studied)? (eg. BS Computer Science)
Sample code or repo, if available 
Date you can start working
How long you have been working with Node.js
Details of experience with technologies listed above
Number of hours per week you can fully commit to
Something quirky/interesting about yourself




Upon conclusion of the internship, which shall last no longer than six (6) months or one (1) semester,  but only for those interns with exemplary performance and work ethic may be granted an opportunity to interview with Apollo DAE for a paid position within the company if the company has the proper funding allocations for that department.

Intern understands, acknowledges, and agrees that there will be no compensation for this position.

Intern will be provided a letter of recommendation that is accurate to their position, work ethic, and performance with Apollo DAE. Intern may apply for college credit and Apollo DAE will work with interns applicable school to aid in this objective.

position: Web Development Intern – Work on new challenges while learning new skills
description:
Who we are.

Part consulting group; part startup accelerator we are a startup of startups.  Our goal is to build a team that can quickly find the valuation of any idea and help bring it to market in an efficient low-cost manner.  This may include software development, UX/UI design, marketing or a number of other skills. Whether it's a client company or an internal idea we have what it takes to make it successful.

We’re looking for a co-founder to join the team and lead a team of senior developers and interns, help with product development and become part of the face of the company.

The ideal candidate is an experienced engineer who is comfortable in both large and small environments. Someone who understands leadership and organizational philosophy and most importantly is still hungry to build companies.  So far it's been a fun idea and we're optimistic about success across multiple areas.

Benefits of working with us:
• Enhance your skillset and knowledge
• Opportunity to learn about many different verticals
• Feel empowered and change things - We value ideas and suggestions
• Work in an inclusive culture where transparency, creativity, accountability and ownership are encouraged
• Freedom to take out-of-the-box approach
• Support and resources to grow into a senior management position
• Flat Organization structure
• Exposure to startup challenges

Who you Are
• People tell you that you have a high attention to detail
• You are a bottom-up thinker, and are wholly unsatisfied with a functional solution that you do not understand
• You write clean, readable, testable and maintainable code
• You love working with other people, and people love working with you

Skills

• Front end development experience, using at least one major client side framework (React, Angular, Vue, etc)
• API development experience, using at least one major server side framework (Django, Rails, Node/Express, etc.)
• Experience using a variety of database technologies (SQL, NoSQL, key-value stores, etc.), and familiar with the tradeoffs and use cases for each

Bonus Skills
• Familiarity with React Native, Firebase/Firestore, GraphQL/Apollo, Docker/Kubernetes, and/or streaming content analytics would be considered a strong plus
• You have solid software engineering fundamentals:
o You understand unit/integration/system testing, and have a practical understanding of when each is necessary
o You have good software design skills, and know how to apply separation of concerns, inversion of control, dependency injection, etc.

About this Job
You'll be joining a growing team in a fast paced, highly rewarding environment. Working alongside other developers, designers and data scientists. Take a look at our brief intro video to learn more: http://bit.ly/howgrowsquaresworks

We're looking for someone with:


Knowledge and hands-on experience in Front-End Development w/ ReactJS & Redux
Experience with HTML, ReactJS, CSS/SASS, JavaScript, Redux, Git, and strong understanding of web technologies (webpack, babel, routing, database, git, responsive design) necessary

3 years of college completed (equivalent to an Associate’s Degree) or Bachelors Degree in Computer Science or related field

👋👋👋IMPORTANT the ideal candidate will have 5+ years of React expereince that they can point us to ( Preact experience is a huge bonus ). 

DIRECTIONS

Please read through this entire listing before applying. If you feel like it’s a good fit, please fill out our brief questionnaire so we can get an idea of your technical background and skill set: https://forms.gle/o2jQMtGAk8xWX4c47

If we feel like it’s a good fit, we’ll reach out and set up a video conference. 

ABOUT THE ROLE

What You’ll be Working On

At Threshold, interns aren’t paper pushers. You won’t schedule meetings, take coffee orders, or organize files 

You’ll work on real projects– projects you’re excited about– projects that have a real impact on our company, our products, and our customers. And you’ll leave with real-world technical, creative, and business skills. 

We're looking for someone with solid front end skills to a) help build out critical new features we built over the past couple months post Covid and b) help optimize the existing platform and increase our Lighthouse scores. 

The intern will basically own these projects in terms of scoping hours, execution, optimization, so it's a great showcase project.  

Project Development
We work in 6 week development cycles as laid out by the team at Basecamp (https://basecamp.com/shapeup). In short, it consists of 1) figuring out what to work on for the 6 week cycle  2) assigning responsibilities 3) reducing risks and 4) shipping on time.  

Location
Our company is 100% remote so you can work from anywhere you want as long as you have a solid internet connection. 

Communication
We’re not fans of organized meetings and other non-essential interruptions, in fact we avoid them as much as possible. With the exception of brief Monday video syncs where we discuss our plans for the week, our communication occurs asynchronously. We use Slack and ClickUp as our primary modes of communication, which we’ll provide you access to. 

Time Commitment
Our internships require a commitment of at least 20 hours a week for 12 weeks. How you choose to manage those hours is completely up to you. 

Compensation
Unfortunately, because we’re a boot-strapped startup with a distaste for debt, our internships are currently unpaid. That being said, unlike a lot of other internships you will be working on important, interesting projects so, at the very least,  you will have left with real-world experience and projects you can point to on your resume.

ABOUT YOU

You have direct experience with our stack– and can show it
Coding isn’t a hobby–it’s your passion. Your Github or Gitlab repos show lots of activity.

You’re passionate about the arts.
You’re not just a technician, you’re a creative. You may or not be an “artist” per se, but you understand the internal drive to create and know first-hand the struggle that comes from pursuing one’s art form.

You’re meticulous about your work
You’re the kind of person who, after building something great, takes a step back and wonders how you can make it better.

You’re always learning
You’re not content with the status quo. You have an insatiable appetite to learn more, to understand better, to make new connections. When you don't understand how something works, you take the initiative to teach yourself. 

You care about people
You enjoy the presence of other human beings and genuinely care about their well-being. You feel totally fine around people who don’t look/think/talk like you.

You’re confident and humble
You’re firm in your convictions but also know full well that you don’t know it all. You’re more interested in finding the best ideas than being right.

You are an excellent communicator
Whether you’re typing or talking, writing an article or giving a speech– you’re a clear and confident communicator.

YOUR TECHNICAL SKILLS

The tech choices below represent our goal of making everything as fast and lightweight as possible. An ideal candidate will have first hand knowledge of each of these and/or their corollaries or can show they're a quick study.

Frontend

• Preact
• Parcel
• Redux-Bundler
• Preact-i18n
• Firebase Hosting, Auth, and Storage
• GraphQl queries
• Google Maps API
• Google Timezone API
• Cypress.io
• Polyfill.io
• Stripe.js
• Workbox
• Mailchimp (non-transactional emails)
• Mandrill (transactional email)

ABOUT THE PLATFORM

-Threshold is a fully responsive Progressive Web App built with the explicit goal of making everything as fast and lightweight as possible.

-Our platform is already built so the next 12-18 months will be spent maintaining, optimizing and adding a few new features.

-We received a top-tier grant into Google's startup program by the Dir. of Engineering and Head of Startup Programs who have both shown interest in the platform from a technical and cultural standpoint.

-The founder, Peter Nelson, attended Earnest Capital’s invite-only Founders Summit this March. 

-We have established trademarks in the US and across 60+ other countries.

-We have extensive documentation, hours of screencasts, and architectural diagrams so it should be relatively straightforward to jump into the project.

ABOUT US

Threshold is a Public Benefit Corporation with a mission to bring Artists a sustainable, living wage. Our platform, helps Artists of all kinds– musicians, authors, speakers, subject matter experts, or anyone else with a fan base– find their fans all over the world and put on events in their fans’ home or business. 

We’re a creative, unconventional company looking for a creative, unconventional engineer to join us on our adventures. Our platform will be officially launching in the coming weeks so we need someone great to take us there.

If you'd like to express your interest in working for State of Place, but don't know what position you'd like to fill, this is the place to do it! We're interested in hearing what you have to offer, so tell us your story. 

In return for your talents and hard work, you will receive excellent Lean Startup business experience, exposure to the urban tech/planning/real estate industry and flexible hours in a fast-paced remote working environment that you can work around your schedule and compensation commensurate with your experience. 

Location: Remote (work anywhere with internet access) but 
preference for those based in New York City, NY; Charlotte/Research Triangle, NC; Metro Washington DC; Boston, MA; Oakland, CA/Bay Area; Las Vegas, NV: Shanghai, China; and Oslo, Norway

Us: A lean-startup-devotee, data-geeky, digital-nomadic, passionate group of city-lovers with a mission to use data to make places more livable, equitable, and sustainable so that people are happier, healthier, and can thrive! More here: www.stateofplace.co

You: An empathetic, eager-to-learn, data-driven/research/product development enthusiast, who is looking to get a taste of the startup rollercoaster, ready to assist us in our software and product development efforts to help us scale the business using AI/visual machine learning/data analytics. You want to love life while working with a dynamic group of just plain-good people working to make the world (at least slightly) better! 

Primary Job Requirements: 


User research, information architecture, wireframing, and prototyping
Proficiency in one or more of the following languages: Python, Javascript, Typescript.
Experience designing and laying out web pages using CSS and modern supporting libraries. 
Experience with modern Javascript frameworks like React, Webpack, and Rollup required. 
Experience using React compatible CSS styling libraries like react-bootstrap, style-components, etc. a plus. 


The Skinny: State of Place can be traced back to 2003, when our Founder/CEO, Mariela, accidentally became a data-geek while creating a tool to objectively measure the built environment characteristics that impact the way people feel about their cities. She soon embraced this new-found title, and began her consulting company, realizing that quantifying what made for good urban design - and calculating its tangible value - was actually the key to convincing people to make cities better (and thereby improve people's lives). Fast forward 15 years later, five years after first offering State of Place as a consulting product, we were awarded a grant from the National Science Foundation's Small Business Innovation Research program that funded the MVP (first saleable version) of our software. Two years later, we have worked with nearly 30 customers in the US and Europe and counting!

Job Responsibilities:

Candidate will work on the design of a wide variety of interfaces, including map-based, reporting, searching, and extensive data management.

What you get: This is an unpaid internship, but you'll get a ton of on-the-job training (you'd be mentored by our Founder/CEO, CTO, and Machine Learning Scientist), enjoy flexible working hours, and gain invaluable experience working with an innovative, fast-paced startup. We also encourage interns to develop a professional development project that they can use to demonstrate improving a skill set or a deliverable/example of professional growth during the internship. 

Duration:
15-40 hours per week; min. 4 month commitment

Location:
Remote (work anywhere with internet access) but preference for those based in North America and Europe (and time zones that line up with them)

Join us in disrupting the urban planning and real estate industries - replacing the top-down, opinion-based, expert-driven approach accessible to a few with a data-driven, evidence-based one, accessible to the many!

We hope you're as stoked as we are to meet you/us! Attach your resume/CV with a cover letter in your Angel List application. If you have any questions, shoot them over to careers@stateofplace.co.

description:
This is a 6 month, unpaid internship. You need to show proof that you can receive academic credit or participate in your university's Co-Op programThe short & sweet summary.
Twine helps companies like Evernote, Birchbox, and DollarShaveClub make smarter people decisions by using predictive analytics and visualizations that replace their clunky HR systems.

We’re a fast-growing SaaS company - growing 30% month-over-month and backed by industry leaders like Adam Grant, founders of billion dollar companies, and Sand Hill Road VCs.

Now we’re looking for software engineering interns *who want massive impact and incredible growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling team. *

Click here to see what one of last year's interns worked on!
What you’ll be doing.

*Learn from excellent engineers a small, highly-collaborative team. *You’ll join a world-class team, including engineers with 10+ years of startup experience and advisors who are founders/CTOs of billion-dollar companies.
*Drive ambitious technical projects that immediately impact our users. *Some upcoming projects: interactive data visualizations (React/D3), API integrations (Python/Airflow), and predictive notifications and alerts (pandas/numpy).
*Grow incredibly quickly as our company scales. *As an early team member, you’ll have massive ownership and a steep learning curve. You’ll pick up new responsibilities as you grow, and work directly with the founders.

What you’ve done.

*You’ve built complex, modern web applications. *You’re familiar with modern web technologies through class projects and previous work experiences. You’ve also led at least one significant project or technical initiative.
*You’re hungry, ambitious, and excited to grow. *Previous interns have learned more in their first week at Twine than in dozens of engineering classes. You learn incredibly quickly and are always looking to take on more challenges and responsibilities.

More about Twine.
Our team: Our CEO, Joseph, spent years immersed in people analytics research and helped found an innovation team at Nike that grew 10X in a year. He’s also an Inc. 30 Under 30 recipient.

Our technology: Our data ingestion pipeline (Python/Airflow) captures people data from recruiting and HR platforms and uses it to create valuable analytics and insights for our users. Our web application is built in Django and React/Redux, and we use D3 for advanced data visualizations. We use AWS infrastructure, and SaltStack to streamline dev ops, scaling, and deployment.

Our values:


Be intellectually curious and humble. Have an insatiable desire to learn, not to be right. Be a “learn-it-all,” not a know-it-all. Have strong convictions, but listen to and learn from others.
Believe in exceptional outcomes. Believe that ordinary people can do incredible things with the right attitude and will. Be positive, inspiring, and optimistic. (At the same time, acknowledge the demanding work ethic and drive required for success.)
Get it done. Focus on rapid learning and execution, and be willing to roll up your sleeves and contribute any way possible. Be indomitably resourceful, drive through obstacles, and deliver on goals.
Help others be great. Treat your teammates, customers, and partners with respect and kindness. Have positive impact on others in all interactions. 


If the role isn’t an exact fit but you’re interested in learning more (we're hiring across the stack), send us a thoughtful note! jobs@twinelabs.com

description:
This is a 6 month, unpaid internship. You need to show proof that you can receive academic credit or participate in your university's Co-Op programThe short & sweet summary.
Twine helps companies like Evernote, Birchbox, and DollarShaveClub make smarter people decisions by using predictive analytics and visualizations that replace their clunky HR systems.

We’re a fast-growing SaaS company - growing 30% month-over-month and backed by industry leaders like Adam Grant, founders of billion dollar companies, and Sand Hill Road VCs.

Now we’re looking for software engineering interns *who want massive impact and incredible growth opportunities in a rapidly scaling team. *

Click here to see what one of last year's interns worked on!
What you’ll be doing.

*Learn from excellent engineers a small, highly-collaborative team. *You’ll join a world-class team, including engineers with 10+ years of startup experience and advisors who are founders/CTOs of billion-dollar companies.
*Drive ambitious technical projects that immediately impact our users. *Some upcoming projects: interactive data visualizations (React/D3), API integrations (Python/Airflow), and predictive notifications and alerts (pandas/numpy).
*Grow incredibly quickly as our company scales. *As an early team member, you’ll have massive ownership and a steep learning curve. You’ll pick up new responsibilities as you grow, and work directly with the founders.

What you’ve done.

*You’ve built complex, modern web applications. *You’re familiar with modern web technologies through class projects and previous work experiences. You’ve also led at least one significant project or technical initiative.
*You’re hungry, ambitious, and excited to grow. *Previous interns have learned more in their first week at Twine than in dozens of engineering classes. You learn incredibly quickly and are always looking to take on more challenges and responsibilities.

More about Twine.
Our team: Our CEO, Joseph, spent years immersed in people analytics research and helped found an innovation team at Nike that grew 10X in a year. He’s also an Inc. 30 Under 30 recipient. 

Our technology: Our data ingestion pipeline (Python/Airflow) captures people data from recruiting and HR platforms and uses it to create valuable analytics and insights for our users. Our web application is built in Django and React/Redux, and we use D3 for advanced data visualizations. We use AWS infrastructure, and SaltStack to streamline dev ops, scaling, and deployment.

Our values:


Be intellectually curious and humble. Have an insatiable desire to learn, not to be right. Be a “learn-it-all,” not a know-it-all. Have strong convictions, but listen to and learn from others.
Believe in exceptional outcomes. Believe that ordinary people can do incredible things with the right attitude and will. Be positive, inspiring, and optimistic. (At the same time, acknowledge the demanding work ethic and drive required for success.)
Get it done. Focus on rapid learning and execution, and be willing to roll up your sleeves and contribute any way possible. Be indomitably resourceful, drive through obstacles, and deliver on goals.
Help others be great. Treat your teammates, customers, and partners with respect and kindness. Have positive impact on others in all interactions. 


If the role isn’t an exact fit but you’re interested in learning more (we're hiring across the stack), send us a thoughtful note! jobs@twinelabs.com

We are looking for an enthusiastic software engineer to build robust server software. Who is Credible?We believe life’s changes create financial needs for people and that the traditional financial system often puts up unnecessary obstacles. People celebrate major milestones like going to college, getting married, and buying a home. And most of the time, these milestones come with financial implications. At Credible, we have built a company with the mission of bringing transparency, choice, simple processes and savings to accessing credit for life’s important moments. What you see is what you get. We are committed to being upfront, honest, and clear about your options. There are no mysteries, no hidden fees, and no secret clauses. Credible is a fast-growing Australian Securities Exchange (ASX) listed Fintech company that has world class management, has raised multiple rounds of funding, is generating significant revenue and is disrupting the lending market and helping people save money and get out of debt faster. About the roleCredible is looking for a motivated Test Automation Intern to come learn and grow with us during the summer of 2019.  Based in the heart of San Francisco's scenic Financial District, you'll join our fast growing engineering team in building out an extraordinary web-based platform that has helped thousands of people save money, and aims to help millions more. This role is ideal for a recent graduate looking to validate their skills or for someone seeking to gain experience before returning to school. Sample Projects Include:* Create extensive test plans and suites that can be automated efficiently.* Perform functional testing on web and mobile.* Find and validate bugs that disrupt user experience or threaten Credible’s functionality.* Using Java Selenium framework, automate tests for new features before they are rolled out to the general public. Education and Experience:* Computer Science majors preferred* Software development and/or testing experience strongly preferred.* Knowledge of test case creation and web app testing required.* Prior experience with Selenium strongly preferred.    Personality and Values:* Passionate about coding; you love to code and you're not shy about showing it.* You thrive on collaboration; Credible's Software team works closely with Product Management, Design and Operations for everything from bug reporting to user testing.* Resourceful and mindful; you move fast but don't break things.* You take pride in maintaining clean, modular code.* Exceptional problem solving and communication skills.Why you want to work at CredibleWe are a fast moving, fun-loving, seriously smart group of people who really care about impacting the lives of our customers. We empower our employees to make decisions, take risks, drive our business and make changes when we don’t get it right. These are our values:* Exceed Customer Expectations: We provide an exceptional experience to each and every customer that compels them to share it with others.* Take Ownership: We are trusted to make decisions that are in the best interests of our customers and our business. We think and act like owners. We care – and that makes all the difference.* Be Curious: We are curious, ask questions, seek to understand and try new things.* Do the Right Thing: We earn trust by being transparent, respectful and honest with each person with whom we interact.* Get Results: Results fuel our excitement and we know how our personal accomplishments tie to the success of the company* Be Bold: We are courageous and take risks that scare us. Our enthusiasm for experimenting is how we will find the next breakthrough. This is a full-time, paid internship during the Summer of 2019. We are an equal opportunity employer and value diversity at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, religion, color, national origin, gender, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Pursuant to the San Francisco Fair Chance Ordinance, we will consider for employment qualified applicants with arrest and conviction records.

description:
A leading organisation is looking for Full Stack Development expertise. This is a full-time work experience role based on a Flask, JavaScript, Python, Django and MongoDb stack. Experience with these technologies is preferred, but a general understanding of full stack development is sufficient. Tasks may include developing new functionality for our web app front end, building new capabilities for our existing mobile app and working on building the web application.
Requirements (nice to haves, but not essential):
• Currently pursuing or graduate in Bachelors of Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related subject.
• Core experience in Python, Flask, MongoDb , Django and JavaScript.
• Basic understanding of Linux servers and shell.
• Relevant experience or understanding of Digital Ocean hosting service.
• Understanding of HTML and CSS.
• Good understanding of version control using GitHub.

A leading organisation is looking for flutter development expertise. This is a full-time work experience remote role based on a Flask, Dart, Python, Flutter and MongoDb stack. Experience with these technologies is preferred, but a general understanding of full stack development is sufficient. Tasks may include developing new functionality for our web app front end, building new capabilities for our existing mobile app and working on building the web application.
Requirements (nice to haves, but not essential):
• Currently pursuing or graduate in Bachelors of Computer Science, Computer Engineering or related subject.
• Experience in building mobile applications.
• Core experience in Flask, Dart, MongoDb , Flutter and Swift and Android.
• Basic understanding of Linux servers and shell.
• Relevant experience or understanding of Digital Ocean hosting service.
• Understanding of developing mobile applications.
• Good understanding of version control using GitHub.

The Software Engineering Intern position will be unpaid until the production launch of the platform.

At BGPC, we are currently looking for developers who are hungry to learn and develop their abilities as software engineers.

In this role, you will work and communicate with team members while developing the frontend and backend of our invite-only dashboard webapp. You will also be required to attend weekly meetings and be given the choice to attend group training sessions for various technologies we use.

For the frontend, we are building the webapp with VueJS, using ES6 JavaScript. As for the backend, we have a serverless setup with AWS (mostly Lambda with TypeScript and DynamoDB). There is also the opportunity to integrate with third party APIs and SDKs using other languages, but that's not yet determined.

You will learn a lot about project management, software architecture, devops, quality assurance, security, asynchronous networking and fullstack development in general.

As stated, this internship will be unpaid until the first production release of the platform. From then, you will be given membership to BGPC, a Canadian non-profit organization, and the ability to earn revenue by participating in or managing your own projects.

The goal of the company is to enable entrepreneurs to gain skills in their field of choice and, with the help of the platform, fund humanitarian projects with some of the revenue generated by projects.

We are not looking for highly qualified engineers, rather people with the will to advance their software engineering skills and perhaps some who align with the company's vision.

Job Description

Listing Bird (listingbird.com) is looking for a highly energetic, reliable, and enthusiastic front-end engineer. This program offers a unique opportunity to build technical skills and propel your career as a front-end engineer forward. The ideal individual will be scrappy, eager to learn, have a must-do attitude, and creative with ideas.** THIS IS AN UNPAID INTERNSHIP    **

About Us

Listing Bird is a SaaS platform that brings Artificial Intelligence to eBay and Amazon Sellers. Our mission is to help each entrepreneur build a successful e-commerce business. We are a single place where Sellers can find the most lucrative products to sell, source through our proprietary platform and expand their e-commerce business across multiple platforms. Our experts guide Sellers on a journey from eBay to Amazon and finally to their own e-commerce platform.   

Responsibilities
• Making a strong impact and iterating quickly - we have an exciting, challenging, and fast-paced product roadmap
• You will own backend feature development end-to-end, spanning data models, testing, scalability, operability and ongoing metrics
• Design and implement distributed scalable services from ground-up. These services will form the building blocks of our cloud-native SaaS platform. These include (but are not limited to) data processing pipeline, micro services, metrics collection, distributed logging etc. 
• Debug and solve fault-tolerance and high availability issues related to these services.
• We need you to be versatile, display leadership qualities and be enthusiastic to take on new problems across the backend as we continue to push technology forward.

Qualifications
• You are comfortable designing data models and working with relational and key-value datastores
• You have experience building APIs
• You have an interest in functional-programming
• You can embrace reactive distributed systems
• You have experience designing and deploying highly available and robust systems with reliable monitoring and logging practices
• You can navigate through ambiguity by turning business requirements into technical solutions
• You are proactive and take ownership of your work from ideation to deployment
• You are passionate about learning and constantly challenging yourself for continuous improvement
• You have strong written and verbal communication skills
• Experience in front-end development and coding a plus

Our Stack
MongoDB, NodeJS, (TypeScript), NestJS

*APPLICATION: *Please apply directly to Husam Alrubaye, CTO at Listing Bird (https://www.linkedin.com/in/husamalrubaye/) - husam@listingbird.com
